transcripts.text: Our next guest says that every believer is prophetic, and that means you too. James, welcome back to Real Life.
Yeah, thank you.  Good to see you.

Good to have you here.  When we hear the word prophet, I think a lot of us think of Isaiah and Ezekiel, Jeremiah, or maybe we know a little bit about New Testament.  But for a Christian, I mean, who's a prophet?  Can our viewers out there, can our viewers say, wait a minute now, I'm not a prophet.  How do I move in that?  Who has the gift of prophecy?

So there's a difference.  You actually asked two questions already, okay?  So who can have the gift of prophecy, but also the distinction of a New Testament prophet?  So in one of the chapters in this book, The Prophet, I talk about four different levels in prophetic ministry.  So there's the occasional gift of prophecy.  a consistent operation.  Then there's the ministry of a prophecy, and then there's the office of a prophet, which is in Ephesians 4, verse 11.  And so the gift of prophecy, 1 Corinthians 14, 1, is for edification, exhortation, and comfort.  But it does not include correction or direction.  But the office of a prophet is different.  It includes that, but it's more governmental.  Ephesians 2.20, the church is built on the foundation of Jesus and apostles and prophets.
